name: putPushDeviceDetails
description: Device registrations can be upserted (the existing registration is replaced entirely) with a PUT operation. Only clientId, metadata and push.recipient are mutable.

X-Ably-Version.description: The version of the API you wish to use.

format.description: The response format you would like

clientId.description: Optional trusted client identifier for the device.

formFactor.description: Form factor of the push device.

id.description: Unique identifier for the device generated by the device itself.

metadata.description: Optional metadata object for this device. The metadata for a device may only be set by clients with push-admin privileges and will be used more extensively in the future with smart notifications.

push.state.description: the current state of the push device.

Recipient.description: Push recipient details for a device.

deviceToken.description: when using APNs, specifies the required device token.

registrationToken.description: when using GCM or FCM, specifies the required registration token.

transportType.description: Defines which push platform is being used.

$ul: **clientId**: Optional trusted client identifier for the device.
**formFactor**: Form factor of the push device.
**id**: Unique identifier for the device generated by the device itself.

**metadata**: Optional metadata object for this device. The metadata for a device may only be set by clients with push-admin privileges and will be used more extensively in the future with smart notifications.
**push.recipient**: Push recipient details for a device.
**deviceToken**: when using APNs, specifies the required device token.
**registrationToken**: when using GCM or FCM, specifies the required registration token.
**transportType**: Defines which push platform is being used.
**push.state**: the current state of the push device.
**serverId**: Server ID with which error was encountered.
